tiled.mapeditor.widget
Class FloatablePanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  tiled.mapeditor.widget.FloatablePanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public class FloatablePanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel

A floatable panel. The panel has a titlebar which displays the panel title plus a small button which can be used to turn the panel into a frame. When the frame is closed the panel is restored. // todo: Prettify the user interface

Version:
$Id$

Constructor Detail

FloatablePanel

public FloatablePanel(java.awt.Frame parent,
                      javax.swing.JComponent child,
                      java.lang.String title,
                      java.lang.String preferencesId)
Constructs a floatable panel with the given title. When the panel is floated, it is placed in a JDialog with parent as its parent.

Parameters:
parent - the parent of the child
child - the child component
title - the title of this panel
preferencesId - the unique identifier for this panel
